channel.title: List Page on OpenEMR
channel.description: Recent content in List Page on OpenEMR

item.title: OpenEMR Announces Sponsorship of HealthHacks 2018
item.description: OpenEMR announced for the second year in a row it will be a sponsor of Virginia Commonwealth Universities (VCU) HealthHacks event; a 24-hour hackathon bringing together students of engineering, medicine, and computer sciences.

item.title: 7 Features to Look For in Your Medical Practice Management Software
item.description: When searching for, it is important to look for some specific key features that enable your team to take full advantage of the platform.

item.title: OpenEMR Offers a Panel of Turn-Key Solutions with Amazon's Cloud Services
item.description: OpenEMR now offers a full panel of easy to install packages on Amazon’s Cloud Services platform, AWS.

item.title: OpenEMR Cloud Standard Edition Now Available in AWS Marketplace
item.description: OpenEMR Cloud Standard is the first EHR in the Amazon Marketplace directly aimed at domestic US providers.

item.title: OpenEMR Version 5.0.1 Released: Ushers in Golden Age for OpenEMR
item.description: The amount of new features and improvements in this new release of OpenEMR is simply astounding and showcases the strengths, diversity, talents, commitment, productivity, and good will of the thriving OpenEMR community.

item.title: OpenEMR, A Great Long Term Choice
item.description: Choosing a free and open source EMR with a history of success around the world is a great move for those looking to avoid vendor lock-in. As a mature project with a vibrant community, OpenEMR is a great choice for the long term.

item.title: OpenEMR Medical Image Viewer
item.description: A team of software engineers within our community recently built the first major medical imaging feature into the system. Given a DICOM file in a patient chart, users can now utilize an easy-to-use medical image visualizer.

item.title: Embracing Docker
item.description: OpenEMR remains in the midst of its Docker revolution with big plans for the future, including utilizing docker images to support medical record interoperability with Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources, patient data analytics with Shiny R, and patient imaging picture archiving and communication system integration with an Orthanc Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) server.

item.title: Accepting Donations on OpenCollective
item.description: Donations speed up and improve the outcome of community requests. It is not simply the case that donating funds to our volunteer developers will motivate us to move faster or produce better results. Historically, hiring trusted development partners and supplying funds to our development teams have proved to move projects to the finish line.

item.title: Students Showcase Solutions for Developing Nations at HealthHacks 2017
item.description: Virginia Commonwealth University’s School of Engineering held their second annual HealthHacks event November 3rd and 4th; OpenEMR was not only a sponsor of the event, but also sent me as a representative offering mentorship to the nearly 130 students participating in the event. Here is my takeaway from this successful event.

item.title: OpenEMR at WONCA SAR
item.description: Matthew Vita, a software developer and project administrator for OpenEMR and Dr. Andre Millet, a physician and medical officer for OpenEMR were pleased to present “Improving Outpatient and Inpatient Care with the OpenEMR Platform” at WONCA South Asia Region 2017.

item.title: Hurricane Maria, Puerto Rico, and the success of OpenEMR customers
item.description: Some had power or a generator, most had no internet access, but all had OpenEMR with individualized customization installed on HITECH Compliance MD-Guardian Server.

item.title: OpenEMR and the 2017 VCU HealthHacks
item.description: OpenEMR is proud to be a contributing sponsor of the 2017 HealthHacks at VCU, a 24-hour event at Virginia Commonwealth University involving engineering, medical, and computer science students coming together to problem solve and innovate on current unmet medical needs.

item.title: OpenEMR Announces Initial Availability of OpenEMR Cloud on AWS
item.description: OpenEMR has joined with industry leading Amazon Web Services to implement and deliver OpenEMR Cloud to healthcare provider practices and institutions throughout the world
